title: Ticket #2524: Verbose/vague procd log concerning cgroup on linux
description:
(13:10:55) psilord: bbockelm, I notice that on Condor versions where cgroup is compiled in, but not available, I see this error:

(13:10:55) psilord: 10/04/11 11:50:10 : GroupTracker (pid = 3069): fopen error: Failed to open file '/proc/3069/cgroup'. Error No such file or directory (2)

(13:11:22) psilord: Now, I fixed that error to emit the file it couldn't find and noticed that cgroups is a little dirty in the output to the proclog.

(13:12:04) bbockelm: what do you mean?

(13:13:13) bbockelm: I'd be happy to clean any log messages.

(13:16:09) psilord: in CGroupTracker::check_process(), if the /proc/%u/cgroup path doesn't exist, you get a D_ALWAYS error so it pollutes the proclog when cgroup isn't available.

(13:17:27) psilord: Also, in that file, shouldn't the "GroupTracker" string in most of the output lines be changed to "CGroupTracker" instead to differentiate the output messages from the other group tracking object?

(13:17:33) bbockelm: ah - will submit a patch for that. Can you write a ticket to remind me then?
creator: psilord
